- Trace Indian agriculture from the Indus Valley civilization (MAINTASK).
- Explain plowing techniques from Vedic literature (MAINTASK).
subtasks: - Detail traditional tools (sickle, winnowing basket, bronze implements; SUBTASK).
- Discuss shift cultivation methods (clearing land, burning; SUBTASK) and continued use of primitive tools (SUBTASK).
- Seasonal crop planting (rabi, kharif, zaid; MAINTASK) and maintenance (weeding, irrigating; SUBTASK).
- Explain modern irrigation methods (drip, sprinkler systems; SUBTASK).
- Differentiate between intensive and extensive commercial farming (SUBTASK) and highlight major crops (wheat, cotton, sugarcane; SUBTASK).
- Address barriers to adopting new technologies (lack of communication, literacy; SUBTASK).
- Discuss government subsidies and policies (support and challenges; SUBTASK).
- Trace historical roots (Albert Howard, 1921; SUBTASK).
- Analyze current market trends and growth (estimated $37 billion; SUBTASK).
- Examine smallholder farmers' role (80% land, 50% livestock; SUBTASK).
- Consider socioeconomic practices (climatic, technological; SUBTASK).
- Highlight initiatives to increase minimum support prices (improving farmer returns; SUBTASK).
- Promote crop rotation, organic farming, and integrated pest management (SUBTASK).
